question: Which state has recently banned the use of 15-year-old government vehicles?
explanation: Government vehicles over 15-years-old have been banned across Bihar while commercial vehicles of the same age will be stopped from plying in Patna and adjacent regions. The decision will come into force on 5th November, 2019. Private vehicle older than 15 years will be allowed to ply if they pass a pollution test. The decision came after several parts of North India including cities in Bihar are reeling under the effect of deteriorating air quality after Diwali.
